title: 113_s1454
content: The Act may be cited as the "Empowering Encore Entrepreneurs Act of 2013" and includes definitions. The Act, titled "Empowering Encore Entrepreneurs Act of 2013," defines key terms such as Administration, Administrator, encore entrepreneur, and nonprofit organization. The Act defines key terms such as organization, small business concern, small business development center, and women's business center. These terms are important for understanding the provisions of the Act. The Empowering Encore Entrepreneurs Program is established under Section 3 of the Act. The Administrator will establish a program to provide technical assistance, mentoring, and training for encore entrepreneurs through contracts with nonprofit organizations and private sector entities. Funds can be used for online resources and virtual networking tools. The program offers technical assistance, mentoring, and training for encore entrepreneurs through workshops, networking events, and self-employment support. Applicants must submit project goals, partner list, and other required information for consideration. Special consideration is given to programs for Armed Forces members affected by base closures or realignment. The program, which provides assistance to encore entrepreneurs, will end on September 30, 2017. Special consideration is given to Armed Forces members impacted by base closures or realignment. SEC. 4. REPORT ON BARRIERS FACED BY ENCORE ENTREPRENEURS. The Administrator must submit a report to the Senate and House Committees on Small Business detailing barriers faced by encore entrepreneurs, including access to credit, federal contracting opportunities, and counseling programs. The report will include barriers encountered by encore entrepreneurs such as access to credit, federal contracting opportunities, counseling, mentoring programs, and policy recommendations for improving Federal assistance.
